meanings.definition: Treat (a metal) to make it less reactive
meanings.sent1: The chemist will passivate the metal to prevent it from reacting too quickly.
meanings.sent2: It is important to passivate the metal to ensure it does not corrode easily.
meanings.sent3: The metal decided to take a break and passivate itself to avoid any unnecessary drama.
meanings.sent4: The protective shield passivated the metal, keeping it safe from harm.
meanings.sent5: Passivating the metal was like giving it a suit of armor against aggressive chemicals.

meanings.definition: Make (a metal) passive by the formation of a protective oxide layer
meanings.sent1: To protect the metal, they will passivate it with a special coating.
meanings.sent2: The engineer will passivate the metal to prevent rusting.
meanings.sent3: The metal felt like a superhero after being passivated with its shiny shield.
meanings.sent4: The oxide layer passivated the metal, making it invulnerable to harm.
meanings.sent5: Passivating the metal was like wrapping it in a cozy blanket of protection.

meanings.definition: Render (a metal) less susceptible to corrosion
meanings.sent1: By passivating the metal, it becomes more resistant to rusting.
meanings.sent2: The technician will passivate the metal to increase its lifespan.
meanings.sent3: The metal passivated itself, determined to stay shiny and new forever.
meanings.sent4: Passivating the metal was like giving it a shield against the elements.
meanings.sent5: The process of passivating the metal made it as tough as a superhero.
